TopicTitle: How to see my crew in a space station

Articles.Content: I built my first station (wehhoo!!) and now I have Kerbals running loose amongst multiple locations on my base. I can't seem to keep track of the little suckers. Is there some view I'm not aware of that lets me see all of them in one list? Right now I have to click on each base component to see who's in there.

This is very simple.
Go into tracking station (It's the little circular-ish building with all the radar panels), and you should then be able to click on your craft and find out who's on there.  I don't know if it allows you to see who's in different capsules, but it definitely works.

Thanks. I was hoping for a way to do it when I'm actually interacting with the station. For example. I want to move Jeb to a ship that's about to undock, but I can't remember which module Jeb is in. Right now I just have to randomly right click on different modules and select Transfer Crew to pull up a list of who's in that module.

Well, if you go into map view, and click on the "Crew" button, it gives you a list showing of all of them -- it tells you the type of module each is in, and which seat (if the module has multiple seats). But if you have three MK1 Command Modules, then you are still left to guess between them. Sadly, clicking on a particular crew member does not jump the focus to that module. Actually, maybe I should suggest that in the bugtracker as an upgrade feature feedback, if nobody else does.

But yeah, I have exactly the same problem keeping track of the little suckers when I load up more than a handful of them.

Alternately, if you turn on the cutaway view (the little circular dot next to the crew pix), you can see inside all the modules at once -- which allows you to spot orange suits and females vs. males, if that helps. It also helps you spot empty seats, which is really helpful in other circumstances.

(... or maybe clicking on a crew portrait should highlight their module purple or something .... Hmmmm.)
